text: So we've got two applications in this one, both of which are new. So I guess we'll start with Bicycle Revolution. I guess it's a suite of events and activations that revolve around cycling, and the Cambridge Cycling Festival will be a part of this moving forward. This will be the first year that this is going to take place, and it's gonna be a variety of events and activations with schools, with businesses, within the community, cafe crawls, education schools, quite a big program of plans is what Sarah and her team have got.  Because it's in its first year I have recommended partial fund. I think it's worth getting behind at this stage in the game but I'm optimistic as to what the benefits may be moving forward because it's in its kind of initial stages but I'm really keen to get behind it with the community event fund and see how it moves over the next 12 months.  Yeah, there's going to be a lot of online tools and things as well and resources for the public. So it's very different to what we've had before. It's not all just a physical event, but I think it's probably going to be something that we're going to see trending over the next few years with events becoming virtual, having to move and shake between physical events and things online. So be quite good to partner with to start off with a small amount and see where it goes. All right.

text: Yeah, so it's both run under Cambridge Cycling Festival Inc, so from that side of it, and because  any organization can apply for multiple events through the funds as long as each event is its own request and recommendation or approval for funding. Yeah, I've suggested a partial fund just because it's,  on the smaller scale in terms of that Bahama Champions brand benefit that we can get back but also it's its first year so some of the items in the budget I think could be worked through but I also think there's a lot of opportunity for us to partner from a results perspective too in terms of getting the message out through marketing and communication so yeah a partial fund is what I've recommended it would be really cool to get them started and hopefully over the next few years get them coming back and then work on that showcase.
